title: Mega-menu is not working on our website
content:
Dear,

We are using Mega-menu on our website it's a Shopify extension and it's our Megamenu is not working when we are using the Firefox browser. We had multiple problems with it when using your browser.


I found this text, that is related to our problem, but there is no replay on how to fix it https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1377960#question-reply This jQuery is not working with Firefox only

Do you have a solution, on how we can fix this problem?


Best regards, Ognjen
creator: omitric

title: Non visualizza correttamente la pagina
content:
Dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento di firefox non visualizzo correttamente la pagine personale del sito www.trello.com, allego immagini per capire meglio il problema(visualizzata da firefox e visualizzata da edge). Non si vede praticamente nulla, neppure il menu. Ho provato ad eliminare l'unica estensione installata 'downloadhelper', ho provato a ripristinare firefox, ho disintallato e reinstallato firefox, ma nessuna procedura ha risolto il problema.

Ho provato a visualizzare il sito con microsoft edge e funziona correttamente. (immagine allegata)

Qualche idea?

Grazie. Alberto
creator: alberto.ferraro

title: 112.01 (64-bit)
content:
Dear Sir or Madam, Since the latest update of Firefox 112.01 (64-bit), there are glitches in playing audio and video, slowing down of the computer and frequent crashes. I would be glad if these problems are fixed as soon as possible.

Many thanks In advance

T. Marzbaan
creator: tmarzbaan

title: Problem with Version 112.0.1 (64-bit)
content: After upgrading to Version 112.0.1 (64-bit) some of my websites are not displaying correctly. When I enter the URL, some text will appear but not the login block so I cannot login to the website. I tried the URL on Microsoft Edge, and the login block was displayed and I was able to login. I'm on Windows 10.
creator: TriPacerGran

title: Webinar and Zoom Meeting Registrations
content: Hello there - previously I was able to register for any Webinars and Zooms quite easily and be able to click on my email inbox preference (in this case Outlook), and it would automatically populate into my calendar in Outlook. Now it goes to download and sits there and does not populate to any reminder area. From trial and error I now have to right click on the downloaded meeting located in the download tab, and this then pulls up a selection of things to do and I have to select 'show in folder'. I then have to double click on the meeting in the download folder, and this takes me to an apps folder window (stating "select an app to open this ics file") where I then need to select Outlook by double clicking on it and it then will go to Outlook and I accept it or confirm it and it then populates into my Calendar. A lot of work when previously I just double clicked on the download file and it instantly went to Outlook and into my Calendar. Is there a way to revert back to this more simple process or is this the new procedure for FireFox. Very laborious I must say! :) Thank you and regards, Gayle
creator: gaylewaldron

title: shortcut gone awry
content:
Over a year ago, I was trying to create a keyboard shortcut when searching in the Firefox address bar. I don't remember exactly what I did, but now when I type in "LNP" to begin the search, it was supposed to route me to a google search of a particular website. It doesn't work and I get this:

https://cse.google.com/cse?cx=b325f6e4087d26def&search=

If I go to the new Google CSE user site, there's nothing in the account. I deleted some of my Firefox extensions, nothing. Can anyone figure out what I did and how I can get rid of it?

Thanks, Tom
creator: tommylisi

title: Eu não estou conseguindo habilitar e fazer uso do navegador em meu sistema.
content: Teria como disponibilizar uma funcionalidade que permitisse a execução do navegador de forma a não haver outros navegadores ou acesso em outros dispositivos que estão inviabilizando qualquer forma de trabalho?
